Context:
Program Name: Hospitality – Hotel Operations Management
Code: H133
Credential: Ontario College Diploma
Method of Study: Full-time
Duration: 2 years (4 semesters)
Starting Months: January, May, September
Domestic Tuition: $4,459.00 *
International Tuition: $18,364.00 **
Location: St. James Campus
Experiential Learning: Hybrid (Fall 2023 - Winter 2024)
Program Overview: Exposure to current and best practices in front office, food and beverage, marketing and sales, conferences and event planning, retirement homes, branded residences.
Industry Certification: Food safety, responsible alcohol beverage service, first aid (CPR).
Fourth Semester: 14-week industry externship.
Related Programs: Tourism and Hospitality Management (H130), Event Planning (H141), Food and Beverage Management – Restaurant Management (H132)
* Domestic tuition might be subject to change based on the specific intake or student status.
** International tuition is for new students. Returning international students may have different tuition rates.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Hospitality – Hotel Operations Management Program H133 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
The George Brown College Hotel Operations Management program is a 14-week industry externship where students complete their placement in a nationwide or international location. This opportunity provides real-world experience and helps students build industry contacts. During their final capstone project, students participate in a hotel operations management simulation to apply their acquired skills.

The European Study Tour is an optional program for students to visit top hotels in Europe to enhance their international hotel management skills. In their fourth semester, students complete the 14-week industry externship as part of their field education.

Graduates of the program gain skills to be progressive leaders within the industry and receive industry certifications in food safety, responsible alcohol beverage service, and first aid (CPR). Students have the flexibility to switch into any hospitality and tourism management programs by their second year, should their interest change. Additionally, graduates are eligible to earn a one-year certificate in Hospitality Services (H101) if they cannot complete their final year of study.

Employment opportunities are abundant in Toronto's hotel industry, with over 38,000 hotel rooms and over 200 hotels. Many graduates work in supervisory and management positions in major hotels nationwide and internationally, while others have reached high-level corporate positions in large hotel chains. Career opportunities also exist in restaurants, casinos, luxury retirement homes, cruise ships, convention centres, entertainment complexes, clubs, bed and breakfasts, catering companies, and conference services.

Graduates of the Hospitality – Hotel Operations Management program may be eligible to enter the Honours Bachelor degree program.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Hospitality – Hotel Operations Management Program H133 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
Extraction:
- Graduates of Hospitality – Hotel Operations Management program may be eligible to enter the Honours Bachelor of Business Administration (Hospitality) degree program at George Brown College as an advanced standing student in September or January.
- Educational path requires a minimum grade point average of 2.7 to qualify.
- Transfer Guide is available for further information.
- The following courses are required in Semester 1: HOST1085, Principles of Hospitality and Tourism Management; HOSF1171, Global Accommodation Industry; HOST1172, Introduction to Wines and Beverages; HOST1170, Introduction to Catering; HOST1068, Smart Serve (online certificate); HOSF1145, Sanitation (online certificate); HOSF1146, Emergency First Aid/Heartsaver CPR (weekend course).
- The following courses are required in Semester 2: HOST1174, Remarkable Restaurant Service – An Introduction to the Industry; HOST1043, Special Events Planning and Delivery; HOST1173, Hospitality Marketing and Social Media; HOST1160, Career Preparation; HOST1175, Global Tourism Geography*; HRM1015, Human Resources Management*; LAW1017, Introduction to Hospitality Law*; ACCT1048, Hospitality Accounting*.
- The following courses are required in Semester 3: ACCT2017, Managerial Accounting; HOST1150, Food and Beverage Cost Control; HOST1193, Strategic Revenue Management; HOSF1095, Front Office Operations; HOST2036, Housekeeping and Facilities Management; HOST1192, Retirement Community Management*; HOST1066, Mixology*.
- Semester 4 includes HOST2084, Hotel Investment Capstone Project (online); HOST2133, Industry Externship; and a GNED General Education Elective.

* Denotes courses with an asterisk are not part of the Hospitality – Hotel Operations Management program but are required for the Honours Bachelor of Business Administration (Hospitality) degree.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Hospitality – Hotel Operations Management Program H133 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
Program Offered: Industry Externship (INDSTRY EXTERNSHIP) under General Education Electives (GENED)

Course Format: seven-week courses

Mandatory Course: COMM 1000 (Introduction to College Communication) for some students, does not count towards graduation and additional charge

General Education Elective Course Outlines and Program Learning Outcomes available at Assessment Centre

Learning Outcomes for the Graduate:
1. Adopt a positive attitude and professional decorum, accommodate diverse and special needs, contribute as a team member
2. Deliver customer service and solutions that anticipate, meet and/or exceed individual expectations, organizational expectations, standards and objectives
3. Use marketing concepts, market research, social networks, sales and revenue management strategies, relationship management skills and product knowledge to promote and sell hospitality services, products and guest experiences
4. Apply business and revenue models as well as basic accounting, budgeting, financial and administration skills to support the effective management and operation of a variety of organizations delivering hospitality services and products
5. Comply with relevant organization and workplace systems, processes, policies, standards, legal obligations and regulations, and apply risk management principles to support and maintain efficient, safe, secure, accessible and healthy hospitality operations
6. Use appropriate technologies to enhance the quality and delivery of hospitality services, products and guest experiences and to measure the effectiveness of hospitality operations
7. Keep current with hospitality trends and issues, and interdependent relationships in the broader tourism industry sectors to improve work performance and guide career development
8. Use leadership, teamwork, conflict and relationship management skills and tools, as well as knowledge of organizational behaviour, labour relations, employment standards and human rights to contribute to a positive work environment
9. Respond to issues and dilemmas arising in the delivery of hospitality services, products and guest experiences by using and promoting ethical behaviour and best practices of corporate social responsibility and environmental sustainability

Tuition & Fees:
Domestic Tuition: $4,459.00  *(Fall 2022 for first two semesters)
International Tuition: $18,364.00 *(Fall 2022 for first two semesters)

Additional Costs: subject to change for programs starting in Fall 2023 and at later dates

Note: † Indicates that tuition fees listed are for the first two semesters of programs starting in Fall 2022 only.

Context:
The text provides information about tuition fees for programs starting in Fall 2023 at George Brown College. Here are the key factual points extracted from the text:

* Amounts listed are the total of tuition, materials, student service and ancillary fees for the first two semesters of programs starting in Fall 2023.
* The amounts are subject to change for programs starting in Fall 2024 and at later dates.
* Textbooks and manuals cost an additional $575 (subject to change).
* International students should visit the International Fees and Related Costs page for more information.
* The program is approved for OSAP funding, but applicants must meet eligibility criteria.
* Applicants require an Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent, Grade 12 English (C or U).
* Mature students may apply with no OSSD and take the Admissions Assessment for English or upgrade their English skills.
* College or university credits may qualify for course exemptions.
* International students should visit the International Admissions page for country-specific admission requirements.
* Health policy states that allergens, including nuts, dairy and shellfish, are used in practical labs. George Brown is sensitive to religious observances but cannot guarantee dietary laws related to halal and kosher foods will be met.
* Domestic students should follow the instructions on how to apply provided later in the text.

Context:
To apply as an international student, you should use the George Brown College Online Application System. For inquiries related to domestic admission requirements, deadlines, or the admissions process, contact the Admissions Office at admissions@georgebrown.ca or visit their web page. For financial and fees-related inquiries, contact the Financial Aid Office at FinAid@georgebrown.ca or visit their web page. For general School of Hospitality and Tourism Management inquiries, contact chcastudentsupport@georgebrown.ca.

International students can also contact a recruitment representative specializing by country of origin by booking a virtual meeting or submitting an inquiry on the International Contact Us page. Visit the campus for a Discovery Day to learn more about programs such as Tourism and Hospitality Management (H130), Event Planning (H141), and Food and Beverage Management – Restaurant Management (H132).

Contact the Contact Centre at 416-415-2000 (TTY 1-877-515-5559) or long distance 1-800-265-2002 for more information. Sign up to receive tailored resources and make your application, your way by booking an info session or signing up now.
